conversation.content:
>> Above is a schema of  5 different intents presented in yaml. Your task will be to classify the given user input which intent or multiple intents it matches. 
>
>> Please consider that you only can retrieve intent Ids as a reference. You also should extract all relevant attributes present in the user input that associated with the chosen intent.
 Every intent in the schema consists of a randomized alphanumeric ID and intent description.
Every intent has attributes associated with them.  It may also contain 'example values', which mean that extracted attributes can be different from those mentioned in schema while maintaining similarity. If multiple attributes are provided, fill all the attributes.  If an attribute value does not exist in the given user text, give " NULL" as the value.
>
>>Please return your answer in the following format:

- <intent_id1>: 
   <attribute_id1>: <attribute_value> 
   <attribute_id2>: <attribute_value> 
- <intent_id2>: 
   <attribute_id1>: <attribute_value> 
   <attribute_id2>: <attribute_value> 



*Utterance for classifying:*

Can you tell me the number of promotions granted to employees across all teams of our company this year?
